metadata.Title: CVE-2017-7846 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
It is possible to execute JavaScript in the parsed RSS feed when RSS feed is viewed as a website, e.g. via "View -> Feed article -> Website" or in the standard format of "View -> Feed article -> default format". This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 52.5.2.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7846` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:52.6.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:52.6.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:52.6.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:52.6.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-testsuite - 1:52.6.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:52.6.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:52.6.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:52.6.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:52.6.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
